intro: Vepris schliebenii, commonly known as the African birch or yellow birch, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The leaves are evergreen, lance-shaped, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed.
